children.name: BaseType
children.summary: Gets or sets the base type of the entity. Returns null if this is not a derived type in an inheritance hierarchy.

syntax.content.vb: Property BaseType As IMutableEntityType

type.name: IMutableEntityType
type.summary:
<para>
Represents an entity in an <xref href="Microsoft.Data.Entity.Metadata.IMutableModel"></xref>.
</para>
<para>
This interface is used during model creation and allows the metadata to be modified.
Once the model is built, <xref href="Microsoft.Data.Entity.Metadata.IEntityType"></xref> represents a ready-only view of the same metadata.
</para>

syntax.content: public interface IMutableEntityType : IEntityType, IMutableAnnotatable, IAnnotatable
syntax.content.vb: Public Interface IMutableEntityType Inherits IEntityType, IMutableAnnotatable

children.name: ClrType
children.summary:
<para>
Gets or sets the CLR class that is used to represent instances of this entity. Returns null if the entity does not
have a corresponding CLR class (known as a shadow entity).
</para>
<para>
Shadow entities are not currently supported in a model that is used at runtime with a <xref href="Microsoft.Data.Entity.DbContext"></xref>.
Therefore, shadow entities will only exist in migration model snapshots, etc.
</para>

syntax.content.vb: Property ClrType As Type

children.name: Model
children.summary: Gets the model this entity belongs to.

syntax.content.vb: ReadOnly Property Model As IMutableModel

type.name: IMutableModel
type.summary:
<para>
Metadata about the shape of entities, the relationships between them, and how they map to the database. A model is typically
created by overriding the <xref href="Microsoft.Data.Entity.DbContext.OnConfiguring(Microsoft.Data.Entity.DbContextOptionsBuilder)"></xref> method on a derived context, or
using <xref href="Microsoft.Data.Entity.ModelBuilder"></xref>.
</para>
<para>
This interface is used during model creation and allows the metadata to be modified.
Once the model is built, <xref href="Microsoft.Data.Entity.Metadata.IModel"></xref> represents a ready-only view of the same metadata.
</para>

children.name: AddForeignKey(IReadOnlyList<IMutableProperty>, IMutableKey, IMutableEntityType)
children.summary: Adds a new relationship to this entity.

syntax.content: IMutableForeignKey AddForeignKey(IReadOnlyList<IMutableProperty> properties, IMutableKey principalKey, IMutableEntityType principalEntityType)
syntax.content.vb: Function AddForeignKey(properties As IReadOnlyList(Of IMutableProperty), principalKey As IMutableKey, principalEntityType As IMutableEntityType) As IMutableForeignKey

parameters.description: The properties that the foreign key is defined on.

type.name: IMutableKey
type.summary:
<para>
Represents a primary or alternate key on an entity.
</para>
<para>
This interface is used during model creation and allows the metadata to be modified.
Once the model is built, <xref href="Microsoft.Data.Entity.Metadata.IKey"></xref> represents a ready-only view of the same metadata.
</para>

parameters.description: The primary or alternate key that is referenced.

type.name: IMutableEntityType
type.summary:
<para>
Represents an entity in an <xref href="Microsoft.Data.Entity.Metadata.IMutableModel"></xref>.
</para>
<para>
This interface is used during model creation and allows the metadata to be modified.
Once the model is built, <xref href="Microsoft.Data.Entity.Metadata.IEntityType"></xref> represents a ready-only view of the same metadata.
</para>

syntax.content: public interface IMutableEntityType : IEntityType, IMutableAnnotatable, IAnnotatable
syntax.content.vb: Public Interface IMutableEntityType Inherits IEntityType, IMutableAnnotatable

parameters.description: The entity type that the relationship targets. This may be different from the type that is defined on when the relationship targets a derived type in an inheritance hierarchy (since the key is defined on the base type of the hierarchy).

This interface is used during model creation and allows the metadata to be modified.

Represents a scalar property of an entity.
</para>

This interface is used during model creation and allows the metadata to be modified.
Once the model is built, <xref href="Microsoft.Data.Entity.Metadata.IProperty"></xref> represents a ready-only view of the same metadata.

children.name: FindForeignKey(IReadOnlyList<IProperty>, IKey, IEntityType)
children.summary: Gets the foreign key for the given properties that points to a given primary or alternate key. Returns null if no foreign key is found.

syntax.content: IMutableForeignKey FindForeignKey(IReadOnlyList<IProperty> properties, IKey principalKey, IEntityType principalEntityType)
syntax.content.vb: Function FindForeignKey(properties As IReadOnlyList(Of IProperty), principalKey As IKey, principalEntityType As IEntityType) As IMutableForeignKey

parameters.description: The properties that the foreign key is defined on.
The primary or alternate key that is referenced.

The entity type that the relationship targets. This may be different from the type that is defined on when the relationship targets a derived type in an inheritance hierarchy (since the key is defined on the base type of the hierarchy).

return.description: The foreign key, or null if none is defined.

children.name: FindIndex(IReadOnlyList<IProperty>)
children.summary: Gets the index defined on the given properties. Returns null if no index is defined.

syntax.content.vb: Function FindIndex(properties As IReadOnlyList(Of IProperty)) As IMutableIndex

parameters.description: The properties to find the index on.

type.name: IMutableIndex
type.summary:
<para>
Represents an index on a set of properties.
</para>
<para>
This interface is used during model creation and allows the metadata to be modified.
Once the model is built, <xref href="Microsoft.Data.Entity.Metadata.IIndex"></xref> represents a ready-only view of the same metadata.
</para>

return.description: The index, or null if none is found.

children.name: FindKey(IReadOnlyList<IProperty>)
children.summary: Gets the primary or alternate key that is defined on the given properties. Returns null if no key is defined for the given properties.

syntax.content.vb: Function FindKey(properties As IReadOnlyList(Of IProperty)) As IMutableKey

parameters.description: The properties that make up the key.

type.name: IMutableKey
type.summary:
<para>
Represents a primary or alternate key on an entity.
</para>
<para>
This interface is used during model creation and allows the metadata to be modified.
Once the model is built, <xref href="Microsoft.Data.Entity.Metadata.IKey"></xref> represents a ready-only view of the same metadata.
</para>

return.description: The key, or null if none is defined.

children.name: FindPrimaryKey()
children.summary:
<para>
Gets primary key for this entity. Returns null if no primary key is defined.
</para>
<para>
To be a valid model, each entity type must have a primary key defined. Therefore, the primary key may be
null while the model is being created, but will be present by the time the model is used with a <xref href="Microsoft.Data.Entity.DbContext"></xref>.
</para>

syntax.content.vb: Function FindPrimaryKey As IMutableKey

type.name: IMutableKey
type.summary:
<para>
Represents a primary or alternate key on an entity.
</para>
<para>
This interface is used during model creation and allows the metadata to be modified.
Once the model is built, <xref href="Microsoft.Data.Entity.Metadata.IKey"></xref> represents a ready-only view of the same metadata.
</para>

return.description: The primary key, or null if none is defined.

children.name: FindProperty(String)
children.summary:
<para>
Gets the property with a given name. Returns null if no property with the given name is defined.
</para>
<para>
This API only finds scalar properties and does not find navigation properties. Use
<xref href="Microsoft.Data.Entity.MutableEntityTypeExtensions.FindNavigation(Microsoft.Data.Entity.Metadata.IMutableEntityType,System.String)"></xref> to find
a navigation property.
</para>

syntax.content.vb: Function FindProperty(name As String) As IMutableProperty

type.summary:
<para>
Represents a scalar property of an entity.
</para>
<para>
This interface is used during model creation and allows the metadata to be modified.
Once the model is built, <xref href="Microsoft.Data.Entity.Metadata.IProperty"></xref> represents a ready-only view of the same metadata.
</para>

return.description: The property, or null if none is found.

<xref href="Microsoft.Data.Entity.MutableEntityTypeExtensions.GetNavigations(Microsoft.Data.Entity.Metadata.IMutableEntityType)"></xref> to get navigation
properties.
</para>
